Rates & Fees*

  • Opening Balance – Kes 2,000.
  • Minimum Operating Balance – Nil.
  • Maintenance Fee – Kes 300.
  • Ledger fees - per entry - Kes 35.
  • Min per month – Kes 350.
  • ATM Card – Kes 430.
  • ATM Withdrawal Charge – Kes 30.
  • Over the counter Withdrawal upto Kes 1,000,000 - Kes 200.
  • Daily amounts above Kes 1,000,000 - Kes 5,000.
  • Cheques returned unpaid
    • Refer to drawer - Kes 3,000.
    • Not arranged for - Kes 3,000.
    • Effects not cleared - Kes 3,000.
    • Technical Reasons - Kes 850.
    • Handling fee for inward unpaid cheque - Kes 585.
    • Stop Payment - Kes 480.
    • Certificate of balance - Kes 1065.
  • Closing Account Normal charges - Nil.
  • Ledger Fees to date or minimum - Kes 350.
  • Counter Debits/Cheques Charges per item - Kes 400.
  • Standing Orders- Applicable as per our standard rates.
  • EFT/Salary Processing - Kes 200.
  • Cash handling
    • For amounts up to Kes 500,000 - Nil.
    • From Kes 500,001 and above - 0.2%.
  • Cheque Book - Kes 8 per leaf.
  • Lcy Bankers Cheques – Kes 200.

What we need from you*

Requirements for Opening an account:

i. Self Help Group

  • Copy of Certificate of Registration.
  • Copy of Constitution.
  • Original Minutes duly confirmed and signed by chairman & Secretary authorizing opening of account, Signatories should be stated and mode of operation well stated.
  • Copy of Pin Certificate for the Signatories.
  • National ID Cards & copies of KRA PINs for authorized office bearers.
  • 1 Passport size coloured photo for each signatory.
  • Societies-Reference from the Ministry of Social Services.
  • Search fee - Kes 1,500.
  • Audited books of accounts if more than one year since registration. If less a template is provided by the bank.
  • List of members.

ii. Groups Not registered:

  • ID copies of signatories.
  • KRA PIN copies.

iii. Society

  • Copy of Certificate of Registration.
  • Copy of Constitution – Signed by Chairperson, Secretary and Treasurer.
  • Original Minutes duly confirmed and signed by chairman & Secretary authorizing opening of account, Signatories should be stated and mode of operation well stated.
  • List of members.
  • KRA PIN for the society.
  • ID Copies for the signatories- Chairman, Secretary and Treasurer.
  • KRA PIN copies of signatories.
  • Search fee - Kes 1,500.
  • Audited books of account if more than one year since registration. If less template provided by the bank.
  • One passport size coloured photo for the signatories.

iv. Limited company

  • Certificate of incorporation.
  • Memorandum and articles of Association/ CR1, CR2, CR8.
  • Company KRA pin copy.
  • Directors' ID copies.
  • Copy of company KRA PIN.
  • One passport size photo coloured photo for the directors.
  • Audited books of account if more than one year since registration. If less template provided by the bank. If less than one year a template provided the bank.
  • Search fee - Kes 1,000.
  • Board Resolution.
"}, {"id": "lzscue5q", "type": "new_info_column", "enabled": true, "product_info_text": "

Qualifying Criteria

  • Open to registered and non-registered groups.
  • Groups of 5-50 members.
  • Banking history: - 6 months - If the chama/investment group has a banking history elsewhere they will be required to open an account with KCB and get financing immediately. No waiting period for new to bank. Required to provide Security - What we buy for the chama is the security to the facility.
  • Ability to repay the facility.

Collateral/Securities

  • Fully secured by land.
  • Lien against FDR.
  • Quoted Stocks at NSE.
  • For ABF finance - Secured by motor vehicles; Plant & Equipment (as per existing ABF product guidelines and checklist).

Rates & Fees*:

1. Internal

  • Competitive profit rate.
  • Competitive commission rate.

2. External

  • Valuation fees, legal fees (for preparation and registration of securities), stamp duty (where applicable).

Transfer/Deposit cash to your Chama Account

From an Individual’s Account in KCB

  • Dial *522#.
  • Enter your KCB Mobi PIN.
  • Select KCB Chama.
  • Select Transact as a Member.
  • Select Transfer Funds to Chama.
  • Select the Specific Chama you are Paying to.
  • Choose Account (if you have more than one account at KCB).
  • Enter Amount.
  • Verify the transaction details and complete the transaction.

From M-PESA

  • Go to the Safaricom M-PESA menu.
  • Select PayBill.
  • Enter the KCB Business Number 522522.
  • Enter your Chama Account Number.
  • Enter the amount you wish to transfer.
  • Enter your M-PESA PIN.
  • Enter your M-PESA PIN and complete the transaction.
"}, {"id": "lzscue5q", "type": "new_info_column", "enabled": true, "product_info_text": "

How to Register:

  • Open a Group/Chama Account at any KCB Branch.
  • Chama members to open individual accounts with KCB.
  • Sign up for KCB Mobile banking.
  • Link the individual accounts to the Chama Account.
  • Officials can add new members or remove existing ones.

", "product_info_columns": [{"id": "m0uo4w0d", "type": "new_info_column", "enabled": true, "product_info_text": "

How to get a KCB Home Loan*

Employed Persons

Please bring original and copies of

  • Pay slips for the last 3 months.
  • Letter from employer confirming employment status.
  • Bank statements for the latest 6 months.
  • National ID or valid Passport.
  • Your KRA PIN certificate.
  • Three passport size photographs.
  • Sale agreement duly signed by both parties and witnessed by a lawyer.
  • Title to property being purchased/charged (minimum lease term must be at least 35 years)

Minimum requirements

  • Open a mortgage account with an opening balance of Kes 10,000.
  • A third of your basic salary is to be left to cater for your living expenses.

Self-Employed Persons & Partnerships

Please bring original and copies of

  • Bank statements for the last 12 months.
  • Your KRA PIN Certificate.
  • Certificate of Registration & Trading License.
  • Partnership Deeds.
  • Audited Books of Accounts.
  • Income tax return.
  • Tenancy agreements for rented properties/rental schedules.

Limited Companies & Investment Groups

Please bring original and copies of

  • Memorandum & Articles of Association.
  • Certificate of Incorporation.
  • Audited Books of Accounts.
  • Your KRA PIN Certificate.
  • Tax Compliance Certificate.
  • Directors Resolution to Borrow.

Construction

Please bring original and copies of

  • Approved building plans.
  • Approved structural drawings.
  • Priced bills of quantities.
  • Profiles for the architect, contractor and quantity surveyor.
  • NEMA approval.
  • NCA Certificate.

Dairy Herd Improvement Loan

This is a loan product intended to boost returns for dairy producers through access to funds for purchase of better breeds of dairy cows.


Benefits

  • Loan repayment duration up to 24 months.
  • Loan amount of Kes 50,000 up to Kes 2 million with animals used as security.

What we need from you*

  • Must be in active dairy farming for at least 1 year.
  • Must be an existing KCB account holder.
  • The dairy activities should demonstrate adequate capacity to service the loan in timely manner.

*A bank representative may call you at any time to obtain further information in line with our KYC process. At no point shall you be asked for your PIN or passwords.  Remember, PIN yako siri yako.


Loan Rates & Fees*

  • Competitive rates.

*Charges are not inclusive of tax

This product targets those involved in the Dairy value chain and are in need of working capital to boost their dairy business. Benefits

  • Loan repayment duration up to 36months.
  • Minimum loan amount of Kes 50,000.
  • Security- chattels mortgage over equipment, joint registration of Motor vehicle.

  • Must be in active dairy farming for atleast 1 year.
  • Must be an existing KCB account holder.

PesaLink is a payment option offered by KCB where you can affordably move funds from account-to-account, instantly. It is easy to access via your KCB online banking, bank mobile app or USSD.

You can receive money into your KCB Bank account instantly from another bank anytime and will also allow you to send money directly from your KCB Bank account to any local bank account instantly anywhere.

Why use PesaLink?


PesaLink is instant available 24/7 and one can transfer from as low as Kes 10 to as high as Kes 999,999 per single transaction. It is also safe since it eliminates use of cash or cheques as a mode of payment.

How to Access PesaLink*

On USSD

  • Dial *522#
  • Select Send Money
  • Select PesaLink Instant Transfer
  • Follow the prompts
  • Confirm the payment

On the APP

  • Open your KCB App.
  • Select PesaLink under Cash Transfers
  • Select Send to Other Bank or Mobile
  • Search and select the beneficiary bank where the receiver's account is domiciled.
  • Enter the recipient account number, recipient account name, amount & submit.
  • Enter the Mobi PIN and confirm.

", "product_info_columns": [{"id": "m13s8rkc", "type": "new_info_column", "enabled": true, "product_info_text": "

Individual Coffee Farmers

Comprises individual coffee farmers, millers, and marketers within the coffee value chain. These customers can access KCB Mavuno Coffee loans under the following three arrangements.

  • Unsecured loans of up to 1 million repayable up to 12 months.
  • Partially secured loans of up to 3 million repayable up to 24 months.
  • Fully secured loans of above 3 million repayable up to 36 months.

Purpose:

This loan is offered to individual coffee farmers, millers, and marketers to finance them with Cherry Advance Payments and Farm Inputs Loan Schemes. Customers can access:

  • Cherry Advance Payments.
  • Farm Input Loans.

Requirements

To qualify for a KCB Mavuno Coffee Loan, a customer must among other requirements:

  • Have an active KCB account.
  • Be a member of a registered coffee cooperative society or factory.
  • Have a positive listing on CRB.
"}, {"id": "m13sak5l", "type": "new_info_column", "enabled": true, "product_info_text": "

Co-operative Societies

Comprises the registered coffee cooperative societies, limited companies dealing with coffee, coffee organizations, marketers, millers, within the coffee value chain. These customers can access KCB Mavuno Coffee loans under the following two arrangements.

  • Unsecured loans of up to 10 million repayable up to 12 months.
  • Fully secured loans of above 10 million repayable up to 36 months.

Purpose:

Loans extended to finance Factory Development & Operations and Farm Inputs Schemes. Loans accessible to these customers are.

  • Factory Development and Operations Loans.

    Fully secured loan repayable up to 60 months.

  • Factory Cherry Advance 

    Unsecured loan repayable up to 12 months.

  • Factory Input Loans. 

    Unsecured loan repayable up to 12 months.

Requirements

To qualify for a KCB Mavuno Coffee Loan, the cooperative societies must among other requirements:

  • Be registered by law with a certificate of registration.
  • Have a clean CRB record.
  • Bank with KCB Bank for at least 3 months.

Rates and Fees

  • Competitive rates.

How to get onto MobiChama*

  • Open a group/Chama Account at any KCB Branch.
  • Chama members to open individual accounts with KCB.
  • Sign up for KCB Mobile banking.
  • Link the individual accounts to the Chama Account.
  • Officials can add new members or remove existing ones.
"}, {"id": "m14sd7xu", "type": "new_info_column", "enabled": true, "product_info_text": "

How to transfer/deposit cash into your Chama Account*

1. From an individual’s account in KCB

  • Dial *225#.
  • Enter your KCB Mobi PIN.
  • Select Chama.
  • Select Transact as a Member.
  • Select Transfer Funds to Chama.
  • Select the specific chama you are paying to.
  • Choose account (if you have more than one account at KCB).
  • Enter amount.
  • Verify the transaction details and commit the transaction.

2. From Safaricom M-PESA

  • Go to Safaricom M-PESA menu.
  • Select Pay Bill.
  • Enter the KCB business number - 522522.
  • Enter your Chama Account number.
  • Enter the amount you wish to transfer.
  • Enter your M-PESA PIN.
  • Commit the transaction.

Borrow loans from Chama (as a member)

  • Go to Safaricom M-PESA menu.
  • Select Pay Bill.
  • Enter the KCB business number - 522522.
  • Enter your Chama Account number.
  • Enter the amount you wish to transfer.
  • Enter your M-PESA PIN.
  • Commit the transaction.

What We Need from from you

  • For principal member: KCB account number, copy of National ID or passport, KRA PIN, spouse’s copy of National ID or passport; children (s) birth certificate or birth notification if less than 2 years.
  • For parents and in-laws: copy of National ID or passport.

Addition of Members

  • Members (i.e. spouse, parents in law or children) could be added at any date during the policy period. They will automatically be covered within the benefit option enjoyed by the family but waiting periods apply. Addition of members shall be allowed ONLY if they did not exist at application.
  • No additional premium will be charged if the added member(s) is within the main package.

Waiting Period

  • The policy has 60days waiting period from the admission date (cover start date) on all causes of death except Accidental. Non-accidental claims within the waiting period will not be payable.

When Do I Claim?

  • You can only claim for natural cause of death if your policy has been active for 3 months and premiums have been paid. However, if death occurs due to an accident, you can claim immediately.
  • Claims are paid within 48hrs after all the required claim documents have been submitted to Liberty Life.
  • *A natural death claim will be paid if the policy has been in force for a minimum period of 2 months and premiums have been received in full.

Simba Junior and Senior Policies

Everyone deserves a happy and healthy life. Protect those that you love with the Simba Health Junior and Senior medical covers:

", "product_info_columns": [{"id": "m1hk8uab", "type": "new_info_column", "enabled": true, "product_info_text": "

Who qualifies for a mortgage from KCB?*

  • Employed Resident Kenyans.
  • Self Employed Resident Kenyans.
  • Kenyans in Diaspora.
  • Employed Resident Non-Kenyans i.e. expatriates.
  • Self Employed Resident Non-Kenyans.
  • Companies and Partnerships.
  • Investments Groups.
  • The only condition is the property offered as security must be in Kenya.

Unique Requirements*

  • Valid sale agreement/offer letter.
  • Open KCB account (KES or USD).
  • Copy of Title to property being purchased or charged must have minimum unexpired lease term of 35 years.
  • Spousal consent / sworn affidavit.
  • Valuation report plus photographs of property being financed and/or charged, together with certificate of official search from Land Registry.
  • Tenancy Agreements for rented property(ies).
  • Where Rent Income is considered a copy of tenancy agreement and copy of title must be submitted.
  • For contract staff - history of previous employment and CV are very crucial.
  • In cases where guarantors are needed- complete information of the guarantor is needed.
  • Pay-slips for the latest 3 months.
  • Letter from employer confirming employment status.
  • Bank statements for the latest 6 months for salaried individuals and 12 months for business clients.
  • Copy of ID or passport & PIN Certificate.
  • Three passport size photographs.

MORTGAGE RELATED COSTS

The following costs are borne by the applicant: -


Internal Costs (KCB)

  • Negotiations Fee or processing fee: at 2.0%. This is for affordable Housing.

External Costs (Valuer/Lawyer/Insurance Company/Government)

  • Valuation Fees: First Kes 2M at 1% Residue at 0.25% Add: Disbursements and 16% Vat. Payable to valuer in the approved bank’s panel for carrying out a valuation of the property being charged.
  • Legal Fees: 2.0% of the loan amount subject to a minimum of Kes. 28,000. Payable to the approved Bank lawyer for drawing charge documents and acting on behalf of the Bank.
  • Stamp Duty:4% of cost of property for purchase cases only.This is payable to the Government on transfer of title.
  • Stamp Duty on Charge:0.1% of loan amount. This is payable to the Government to register the charge.

Insurances:

  • Mortgage Protection Insurance (MPI) - 0.42% of loan amount (I PERSON @ 0.42%), (2 PERSONS @ 0.63%). At the release of funds, the premium is paid in full or prorated. Thereafter on a monthly basis and is included in the loan repayment. The benefit of the insurance is that in the event of death of the borrower, the loan outstanding will be paid in full.
  • House Owners Comprehensive Insurance (HOCI) + Social Perils. - Residential 1.25 per 1000 plus 0.05% of the insurance value. At the release of funds, the premium is paid in full or prorated. Thereafter on a monthly basis and is included in the loan repayment. The benefit of this cover is that it gives the customer comfort that the house will be restored 100% to the condition it was before the damage. Social perils include; Fire, Floods, Impact damage (e.g. from falling trees, electric poles), earthquakes, Landslides, Terrorisms.
  • Retrenchment (for employed) - Kes 1,500.00 p.a. or Kes 125.00 p.m. In the event of loss of job due to retrenchment loan repayments will be made monthly for nine (9) months. Maximum loan repayment on retrenchment is Kes.3 Million.
  • Mortgage Guarantee Indemnity(MDGI) - 2.5% on excess of 90. 2.5 on the excess 90% and 15% basing from 100% and 105% financing.
"}, {"id": "m1hkd5wc", "type": "new_info_column", "enabled": true, "product_info_text": "

Construction cases Requirements*

  • Submission of approved building plans.
  • Submission of approved structural drawings.
  • Submission of priced Bill of Quantities (BQ’s) duly signed.
  • Completion as per approved building plans.
  • National construction authority certificate (NCA).
  • Submission of a National Environment Management Authority (NEMA) approval of the Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA / Audit report for the proposed / existing development OR a letter of Exemption from NEMA requirements.
  • Project team (architect, civil & structural engineers, contractor, quantity surveyor) to submit their comprehensive CV’s, registration certificates with current practicing license & profiles detailing successful works carried out in the last 5 to 10 years.
  • Appointment of a suitably qualified project manager to bring the necessary professional supervision into the project. If the project manager is not among the project team the he / she should submit their comprehensive CV, registration certificate with current practicing license & profiles detailing successful works carried out in the last 5 to 10 years.
  • Submission of a duly executed formal contract between the developer (sponsor) and the contractor.
  • Submission of a contractor’s all risk policy with the interest of KCB duly noted.
  • Submission of a performance bond from a reputable bank or insurance firm for 10% of the contract value.
  • Subject to the applicant(s) fully utilizing their contribution (equity) upfront.

Sources of Income Considered*

Verifiable and regular income such as: -


  • Salary.
  • Rent income.
  • Business Income.
  • Commissions.
  • Monthly Contributions for Investment Groups.
  • Pensions.

", "product_info_columns": [{"id": "m1hk8uab", "type": "new_info_column", "enabled": true, "product_info_text": "

Who qualifies for a mortgage from KCB?*

  • Employed Resident Kenyans.
  • Self Employed Resident Kenyans.
  • Kenyans in Diaspora.
  • Employed Resident Non-Kenyans i.e. expatriates.
  • Self Employed Resident Non-Kenyans.
  • Companies and Partnerships.
  • Investments Groups.
  • The only condition is the property offered as security must be in Kenya.

Unique Requirements*

  • Valid sale agreement/offer letter.
  • Open KCB account (KES or USD).
  • Copy of Title to property being purchased or charged must have minimum unexpired lease term of 35 years.
  • Spousal consent / sworn affidavit.
  • Valuation report plus photographs of property being financed and/or charged, together with certificate of official search from Land Registry.
  • Tenancy Agreements for rented property(ies).
  • Where Rent Income is considered a copy of tenancy agreement and copy of title must be submitted.
  • For contract staff - history of previous employment and CV are very crucial.
  • In cases where guarantors are needed- complete information of the guarantor is needed.
  • Pay-slips for the latest 3 months.
  • Letter from employer confirming employment status.
  • Bank statements for the latest 6 months for salaried individuals and 12 months for business clients.
  • Copy of ID or passport & PIN Certificate.
  • Three passport size photographs.

MORTGAGE RELATED COSTS

The following costs are borne by the applicant: -


Internal Costs (KCB)

  • Negotiations Fee or processing fee: at 2.0%. This is for affordable Housing.

External Costs (Valuer/Lawyer/Insurance Company/Government)

  • Valuation Fees: First Kes 2M at 1% Residue at 0.25% Add: Disbursements and 16% Vat. Payable to valuer in the approved bank’s panel for carrying out a valuation of the property being charged.
  • Legal Fees: 2.0% of the loan amount subject to a minimum of Kes. 28,000. Payable to the approved Bank lawyer for drawing charge documents and acting on behalf of the Bank.
  • Stamp Duty:4% of cost of property for purchase cases only.This is payable to the Government on transfer of title.
  • Stamp Duty on Charge:0.1% of loan amount. This is payable to the Government to register the charge.

Insurances:

  • Mortgage Protection Insurance (MPI) - 0.42% of loan amount (I PERSON @ 0.42%), (2 PERSONS @ 0.63%). At the release of funds, the premium is paid in full or prorated. Thereafter on a monthly basis and is included in the loan repayment. The benefit of the insurance is that in the event of death of the borrower, the loan outstanding will be paid in full.
  • House Owners Comprehensive Insurance (HOCI) + Social Perils. - Residential 1.25 per 1000 plus 0.05% of the insurance value. At the release of funds, the premium is paid in full or prorated. Thereafter on a monthly basis and is included in the loan repayment. The benefit of this cover is that it gives the customer comfort that the house will be restored 100% to the condition it was before the damage. Social perils include; Fire, Floods, Impact damage (e.g. from falling trees, electric poles), earthquakes, Landslides, Terrorisms.
  • Retrenchment (for employed) - Kes 1,500.00 p.a. or Kes 125.00 p.m. In the event of loss of job due to retrenchment loan repayments will be made monthly for nine (9) months. Maximum loan repayment on retrenchment is Kes.3 Million.
  • Mortgage Guarantee Indemnity(MDGI) - 2.5% on excess of 90. 2.5 on the excess 90% and 15% basing from 100% and 105% financing.
"}, {"id": "m1hkd5wc", "type": "new_info_column", "enabled": true, "product_info_text": "

Construction cases Requirements*

  • Submission of approved building plans.
  • Submission of approved structural drawings.
  • Submission of priced Bill of Quantities (BQ’s) duly signed.
  • Completion as per approved building plans.
  • National construction authority certificate (NCA).
  • Submission of a National Environment Management Authority (NEMA) approval of the Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA / Audit report for the proposed / existing development OR a letter of Exemption from NEMA requirements.
  • Project team (architect, civil & structural engineers, contractor, quantity surveyor) to submit their comprehensive CV’s, registration certificates with current practicing license & profiles detailing successful works carried out in the last 5 to 10 years.
  • Appointment of a suitably qualified project manager to bring the necessary professional supervision into the project. If the project manager is not among the project team the he / she should submit their comprehensive CV, registration certificate with current practicing license & profiles detailing successful works carried out in the last 5 to 10 years.
  • Submission of a duly executed formal contract between the developer (sponsor) and the contractor.
  • Submission of a contractor’s all risk policy with the interest of KCB duly noted.
  • Submission of a performance bond from a reputable bank or insurance firm for 10% of the contract value.
  • Subject to the applicant(s) fully utilizing their contribution (equity) upfront.

Sources of Income Considered*

Verifiable and regular income such as: -


  • Salary.
  • Rent income.
  • Business Income.
  • Commissions.
  • Monthly Contributions for Investment Groups.
  • Pensions.
"}], "alt_seo_canonical_url": null, "override_default_form": false, "related_products_title": "You might also be interested in:", "enable_product_features": true, "enable_related_products": false, "alt_seo_meta_description": null, "enable_product_infolinks": false, "related_products_cta_text": "Learn about {{title}}", "alt_seo_social_description": null}

", "product_info_columns": [{"id": "m1hk8uab", "type": "new_info_column", "enabled": true, "product_info_text": "

Who qualifies for a mortgage from KCB?*

  • Employed Resident Kenyans.
  • Self Employed Resident Kenyans.
  • Kenyans in Diaspora.
  • Employed Resident Non-Kenyans i.e. expatriates.
  • Self Employed Resident Non-Kenyans.
  • Companies and Partnerships.
  • Investments Groups.
  • The only condition is the property offered as security must be in Kenya.

Unique Requirements*

  • Valid sale agreement/offer letter.
  • Open KCB account (KES or USD).
  • Copy of Title to property being purchased or charged must have minimum unexpired lease term of 35 years.
  • Spousal consent / sworn affidavit.
  • Valuation report plus photographs of property being financed and/or charged, together with certificate of official search from Land Registry.
  • Tenancy Agreements for rented property(ies).
  • Where Rent Income is considered a copy of tenancy agreement and copy of title must be submitted.
  • For contract staff - history of previous employment and CV are very crucial.
  • In cases where guarantors are needed- complete information of the guarantor is needed.
  • Pay-slips for the latest 3 months.
  • Letter from employer confirming employment status.
  • Bank statements for the latest 6 months for salaried individuals and 12 months for business clients.
  • Copy of ID or passport & PIN Certificate.
  • Three passport size photographs.

MORTGAGE RELATED COSTS

The following costs are borne by the applicant: -


Internal Costs (KCB)

  • Negotiations Fee or processing fee: at 2.0%. This is for affordable Housing.

External Costs (Valuer/Lawyer/Insurance Company/Government)

  • Valuation Fees: First Kes 2M at 1% Residue at 0.25% Add: Disbursements and 16% Vat. Payable to valuer in the approved bank’s panel for carrying out a valuation of the property being charged.
  • Legal Fees: 2.0% of the loan amount subject to a minimum of Kes. 28,000. Payable to the approved Bank lawyer for drawing charge documents and acting on behalf of the Bank.
  • Stamp Duty:4% of cost of property for purchase cases only.This is payable to the Government on transfer of title.
  • Stamp Duty on Charge:0.1% of loan amount. This is payable to the Government to register the charge.

Insurances:

  • Mortgage Protection Insurance (MPI) - 0.42% of loan amount (I PERSON @ 0.42%), (2 PERSONS @ 0.63%). At the release of funds, the premium is paid in full or prorated. Thereafter on a monthly basis and is included in the loan repayment. The benefit of the insurance is that in the event of death of the borrower, the loan outstanding will be paid in full.
  • House Owners Comprehensive Insurance (HOCI) + Social Perils. - Residential 1.25 per 1000 plus 0.05% of the insurance value. At the release of funds, the premium is paid in full or prorated. Thereafter on a monthly basis and is included in the loan repayment. The benefit of this cover is that it gives the customer comfort that the house will be restored 100% to the condition it was before the damage. Social perils include; Fire, Floods, Impact damage (e.g. from falling trees, electric poles), earthquakes, Landslides, Terrorisms.
  • Retrenchment (for employed) - Kes 1,500.00 p.a. or Kes 125.00 p.m. In the event of loss of job due to retrenchment loan repayments will be made monthly for nine (9) months. Maximum loan repayment on retrenchment is Kes.3 Million.
  • Mortgage Guarantee Indemnity(MDGI) - 2.5% on excess of 90. 2.5 on the excess 90% and 15% basing from 100% and 105% financing.
"}, {"id": "m1hkd5wc", "type": "new_info_column", "enabled": true, "product_info_text": "

Construction cases Requirements*

  • Submission of approved building plans.
  • Submission of approved structural drawings.
  • Submission of priced Bill of Quantities (BQ’s) duly signed.
  • Completion as per approved building plans.
  • National construction authority certificate (NCA).
  • Submission of a National Environment Management Authority (NEMA) approval of the Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA / Audit report for the proposed / existing development OR a letter of Exemption from NEMA requirements.
  • Project team (architect, civil & structural engineers, contractor, quantity surveyor) to submit their comprehensive CV’s, registration certificates with current practicing license & profiles detailing successful works carried out in the last 5 to 10 years.
  • Appointment of a suitably qualified project manager to bring the necessary professional supervision into the project. If the project manager is not among the project team the he / she should submit their comprehensive CV, registration certificate with current practicing license & profiles detailing successful works carried out in the last 5 to 10 years.
  • Submission of a duly executed formal contract between the developer (sponsor) and the contractor.
  • Submission of a contractor’s all risk policy with the interest of KCB duly noted.
  • Submission of a performance bond from a reputable bank or insurance firm for 10% of the contract value.
  • Subject to the applicant(s) fully utilizing their contribution (equity) upfront.

Sources of Income Considered*

Verifiable and regular income such as: -


  • Salary.
  • Rent income.
  • Business Income.
  • Commissions.
  • Monthly Contributions for Investment Groups.
  • Pensions.
"}], "alt_seo_canonical_url": null, "override_default_form": false, "related_products_title": "You might also be interested in:", "enable_product_features": false, "enable_related_products": false, "alt_seo_meta_description": null, "enable_product_infolinks": false, "related_products_cta_text": "Learn about {{title}}", "alt_seo_social_description": null}

Unique Requirements*

  • Valid sale agreement/offer letter.
  • Open KCB account (KES or USD).
  • Copy of Title to property being purchased or charged must have minimum unexpired lease term of 35 years.
  • Spousal consent / sworn affidavit.
  • Valuation report plus photographs of property being financed and/or charged, together with certificate of official search from Land Registry.
  • Tenancy Agreements for rented property(ies).
  • Where Rent Income is considered a copy of tenancy agreement and copy of title must be submitted.
  • For contract staff - history of previous employment and CV are very crucial.
  • In cases where guarantors are needed- complete information of the guarantor is needed.
  • Pay-slips for the latest 3 months.
  • Letter from employer confirming employment status.
  • Bank statements for the latest 6 months for salaried individuals and 12 months for business clients.
  • Copy of ID or passport & PIN Certificate.
  • Three passport size photographs.

MORTGAGE RELATED COSTS

The following costs are borne by the applicant: -


Internal Costs (KCB)

  • Negotiations Fee or processing fee: at 2.0%. This is for affordable Housing.

External Costs (Valuer/Lawyer/Insurance Company/Government)

  • Valuation Fees: First Kes 2M at 1% Residue at 0.25% Add: Disbursements and 16% Vat. Payable to valuer in the approved bank’s panel for carrying out a valuation of the property being charged.
  • Legal Fees: 2.0% of the loan amount subject to a minimum of Kes 28,000. Payable to the approved Bank lawyer for drawing charge documents and acting on behalf of the Bank.
  • Stamp Duty:4% of cost of property for purchase cases only. This is payable to the Government on transfer of title.
  • Stamp Duty on Charge:0.1% of loan amount. This is payable to the Government to register the charge.

Insurances:

  • Mortgage Protection Insurance (MPI) - 0.42% of loan amount (I PERSON @ 0.42%), (2 PERSONS @ 0.63%). At the release of funds, the premium is paid in full or prorated. Thereafter on a monthly basis and is included in the loan repayment. The benefit of the insurance is that in the event of death of the borrower, the loan outstanding will be paid in full.
  • House Owners Comprehensive Insurance (HOCI) + Social Perils. - Residential 1.25 per 1000 plus 0.05% of the insurance value. At the release of funds, the premium is paid in full or prorated. Thereafter on a monthly basis and is included in the loan repayment. The benefit of this cover is that it gives the customer comfort that the house will be restored 100% to the condition it was before the damage. Social perils include; Fire, Floods, Impact damage (e.g. from falling trees, electric poles), earthquakes, Landslides, Terrorisms.
  • Retrenchment (for employed) - Kes 1,500.00 p.a. or Kes 125.00 p.m. In the event of loss of job due to retrenchment loan repayments will be made monthly for nine (9) months. Maximum loan repayment on retrenchment is Kes.3 Million.
  • Mortgage Guarantee Indemnity(MDGI) - 2.5% on excess of 90. 2.5 on the excess 90% and 15% basing from 100% and 105% financing.
"}, {"id": "m1hkd5wc", "type": "new_info_column", "enabled": true, "product_info_text": "

Construction cases Requirements*

  • Submission of approved building plans.
  • Submission of approved structural drawings.
  • Submission of priced Bill of Quantities (BQ’s) duly signed.
  • Completion as per approved building plans.
  • National construction authority certificate (NCA).
  • Submission of a National Environment Management Authority (NEMA) approval of the Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA / Audit report for the proposed / existing development OR a letter of Exemption from NEMA requirements.
  • Project team (architect, civil & structural engineers, contractor, quantity surveyor) to submit their comprehensive CV’s, registration certificates with current practicing license & profiles detailing successful works carried out in the last 5 to 10 years.
  • Appointment of a suitably qualified project manager to bring the necessary professional supervision into the project. If the project manager is not among the project team the he / she should submit their comprehensive CV, registration certificate with current practicing license & profiles detailing successful works carried out in the last 5 to 10 years.
  • Submission of a duly executed formal contract between the developer (sponsor) and the contractor.
  • Submission of a contractor’s all risk policy with the interest of KCB duly noted.
  • Submission of a performance bond from a reputable bank or insurance firm for 10% of the contract value.
  • Subject to the applicant(s) fully utilizing their contribution (equity) upfront.

Sources of Income Considered*

Verifiable and regular income such as: -


  • Salary.
  • Rent income.
  • Business Income.
  • Commissions.
  • Monthly Contributions for Investment Groups.
  • Pensions.

The benefit of this cover is that it gives the customer comfort that the house will be restored 100% to the condition it was before the damage. Social perils include; Fire, Floods, Impact damage (e.g. from falling trees, electric poles), earthquakes, Landslides, Terrorisms.
  • Retrenchment (for employed) - Kes 1,500.00 p.a. or Kes 125.00 p.m. In the event of loss of job due to retrenchment loan repayments will be made monthly for nine (9) months. Maximum loan repayment on retrenchment is Kes.3 Million.
  • Mortgage Guarantee Indemnity(MDGI) - 2.5% on excess of 90. 2.5 on the excess 90% and 15% basing from 100% and 105% financing.

Construction cases Requirements*

  • Submission of approved building plans.
  • Submission of approved structural drawings.
  • Submission of priced Bill of Quantities (BQ’s) duly signed.
  • Completion as per approved building plans.
  • National construction authority certificate (NCA).
  • Submission of a National Environment Management Authority (NEMA) approval of the Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA / Audit report for the proposed / existing development OR a letter of Exemption from NEMA requirements.
  • Project team (architect, civil & structural engineers, contractor, quantity surveyor) to submit their comprehensive CV’s, registration certificates with current practicing license & profiles detailing successful works carried out in the last 5 to 10 years.
  • Appointment of a suitably qualified project manager to bring the necessary professional supervision into the project. If the project manager is not among the project team the he / she should submit their comprehensive CV, registration certificate with current practicing license & profiles detailing successful works carried out in the last 5 to 10 years.
  • Submission of a duly executed formal contract between the developer (sponsor) and the contractor.
  • Submission of a contractor’s all risk policy with the interest of KCB duly noted.
  • Submission of a performance bond from a reputable bank or insurance firm for 10% of the contract value.
  • Subject to the applicant(s) fully utilizing their contribution (equity) upfront.

Sources of Income Considered*

Verifiable and regular income such as: -


  • Salary.
  • Rent income.
  • Business Income.
  • Commissions.
  • Monthly Contributions for Investment Groups.
  • Pensions.

", "product_info_columns": [{"id": "m1hk8uab", "type": "new_info_column", "enabled": true, "product_info_text": "

Who qualifies for a mortgage from KCB?*

  • Employed Resident Kenyans.
  • Self Employed Resident Kenyans.
  • Kenyans in Diaspora.
  • Employed Resident Non-Kenyans i.e. expatriates.
  • Self Employed Resident Non-Kenyans.
  • Companies and Partnerships.
  • Investments Groups.
  • The only condition is the property offered as security must be in Kenya.

Unique Requirements*

  • Valid sale agreement/offer letter.
  • Open KCB account (KES or USD).
  • Copy of Title to property being purchased or charged must have minimum unexpired lease term of 35 years.
  • Spousal consent / sworn affidavit.
  • Valuation report plus photographs of property being financed and/or charged, together with certificate of official search from Land Registry.
  • Tenancy Agreements for rented property(ies).
  • Where Rent Income is considered a copy of tenancy agreement and copy of title must be submitted.
  • For contract staff - history of previous employment and CV are very crucial.
  • In cases where guarantors are needed- complete information of the guarantor is needed.
  • Pay-slips for the latest 3 months.
  • Letter from employer confirming employment status.
  • Bank statements for the latest 6 months for salaried individuals and 12 months for business clients.
  • Copy of ID or passport & PIN Certificate.
  • Three passport size photographs.

MORTGAGE RELATED COSTS

The following costs are borne by the applicant: -


Internal Costs (KCB)

  • Negotiations Fee or processing fee: at 2.0%. This is for affordable Housing.

External Costs (Valuer/Lawyer/Insurance Company/Government)

  • Valuation Fees: First Kes 2M at 1% Residue at 0.25% Add: Disbursements and 16% Vat. Payable to valuer in the approved bank’s panel for carrying out a valuation of the property being charged.
  • Legal Fees: 2.0% of the loan amount subject to a minimum of Kes 28,000. Payable to the approved Bank lawyer for drawing charge documents and acting on behalf of the Bank.
  • Stamp Duty:4% of cost of property for purchase cases only. This is payable to the Government on transfer of title.
  • Stamp Duty on Charge:0.1% of loan amount. This is payable to the Government to register the charge.

Insurances:

  • Mortgage Protection Insurance (MPI) - 0.42% of loan amount (I PERSON @ 0.42%), (2 PERSONS @ 0.63%). At the release of funds, the premium is paid in full or prorated. Thereafter on a monthly basis and is included in the loan repayment. The benefit of the insurance is that in the event of death of the borrower, the loan outstanding will be paid in full.
  • House Owners Comprehensive Insurance (HOCI) + Social Perils. - Residential 1.25 per 1000 plus 0.05% of the insurance value. At the release of funds, the premium is paid in full or prorated. Thereafter on a monthly basis and is included in the loan repayment. The benefit of this cover is that it gives the customer comfort that the house will be restored 100% to the condition it was before the damage. Social perils include; Fire, Floods, Impact damage (e.g. from falling trees, electric poles), earthquakes, Landslides, Terrorisms.
  • Retrenchment (for employed) - Kes 1,500.00 p.a. or Kes 125.00 p.m. In the event of loss of job due to retrenchment loan repayments will be made monthly for nine (9) months. Maximum loan repayment on retrenchment is Kes 3 Million.
  • Mortgage Guarantee Indemnity(MDGI) - 2.5% on excess of 90. 2.5 on the excess 90% and 15% basing from 100% and 105% financing.

{"seo": [], "ctas": [{"id": "m0tj21ur", "type": "new_cta", "enabled": true, "cta_icon": "las la-arrow-right", "cta_text": "Get a call back"}], "faqs": null, "title": "Insurance Premium Finance (IPF)", "header": "headers/country", "content": "

This product enables customer to pay their premiums over time by reducing the financial strain of lumpsum premium payments.

IPF facility has a tenor of between 1-12 months depending on the underlying policy. IPFs covering medical policies have a maximum tenor of 6 months but where the Insurance company expressly accepts the risk, it can run for a maximum of 10 months.

The product is self-securing and customer has options of selecting a wide range of approved underwriters within the banks panel.
